html.p: Scope: Splunk Enterprise and Splunk Cloud
Splunk is committed to removing signs of institutionalized bias in our products, our documentation, and our language. For more on this effort, read this blog post.
As an initial step, we’ve removed several major instances of biased language in licensing workflows including the replacement of ‘master’ / ‘slave’ with ‘manager’ / ‘peer’ terms in:

ol.li: the UI including the Licensing Page, Change Master Association Workflow, License Usage Reporting, License Pools, License Alerts

html.p: We’ve also included a deprecation note in licensing conf files about these old terms, and the relevant documentation updates to reflect these changes for this release.

Lastly, we’ve removed biased language by changing the terms ‘master’ / ‘slave’ / ‘whitelist’ / ‘blacklist’ with ‘manager’ / ‘peer’ / ‘allow list’ / ‘deny list’ in the administrative workflows as well by updating the UI, and respective files associated with the following pages and workflows:
